content.en: Supply Chain Optimization: Researchers have developed various algorithms to address different challenges in supply chain network design. These algorithms, such as Benders' decomposition, outer approximation, Lagrangian relaxation, and tabu search, are used to solve complex optimization problems and make efficient decisions regarding facility location, inventory management, routing, and transportation choices. By applying these algorithms, researchers aim to optimize the design of supply chain networks and improve their performance under uncertainty and disruption risks.
content.da: Forsyningskædeoptimering: Forskere har udviklet forskellige algoritmer for at imødegå forskellige udfordringer i design af forsyningskædenetværk. Disse algoritmer, såsom Benders’ dekomposition, ydre approximation, Lagrange-relaksation og tabu-søgning, anvendes til at løse komplekse optimeringsproblemer og træffe effektive beslutninger vedrørende facilitetslokation, lagerstyring, ruteplanlægning og transportvalg. Ved at anvende disse algoritmer stræber forskerne efter at optimere designet af forsyningskædenetværk og forbedre deres ydeevne under usikkerhed og risiko for forstyrrelser.
